titles.title: Bishoujo Yuugi Unit Crane Game
美少女遊戯ユニットクレーンゲール
Crane Game Girls
Crane Game Girls

relatedanime.anime: Bishoujo Yuugi Unit Crane Game Galaxy

recommendations.recommendation: This is an anime with the theme of becoming an idol and saving the earth, but actually aims to teach people different techniques for playing crane games.

anime.description: Only the three girls — http://anidb.net/ch80779 [Mirai], http://anidb.net/ch80782 [Ayaka], and http://anidb.net/ch80783 [Kyouko] — can save Earth from being destroyed by a group of asteroids. They are hired by http://anidb.net/ch80781 [Sayo], the representative of a shadowy organization bent on turning them into an idol group. While the trio are more than prepared to be idols, they are instead taken into an arcade. Source: ANN

externalentity.identifier: 美少女遊戯ユニット_クレーンゲール

tag.name: bishoujo
tag.description: In Japanese, a bishoujo is any pretty female from toddlerhood to late adolescence. In the West, the word specifically refers to attractive girls generally from late childhood or early adolescence, especially those that appeal to males, and particularly to fictional characters designed in a way traditionally associated to shoujo manga. Fictional bishoujo tend to be cute, pastel-coloured teenagers; they lack the sophistication of older women, instead having detailed eye and hair design, fluttery costumes often including ribbons, and all sorts of generally sparkly fluff.

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: training
tag.description: Training is extensive, serious practising a person undergoes in order to develop skills and abilities, such as handling weapons, playing instruments, playing sports, and so on.

tag.name: saving the world
tag.description: While villains love to take over the world or cause the end of the world as we know it, the heroes are most likely motivated by the polar opposite, saving the world. A fairly simple plot/motivation related to for great justice and what not, this trope is pretty broad and very common for many stories not focused on character interaction only. Source: TV Trope

tag.name: commercial
tag.description: This title is used to sell and/or promote a real-life product or service. Not to be confused with "product placement" or "subliminal advertising" — this features *direct* promotion for such element. Depending on the setting, some could even be considered as "animated infomercials".

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: 絶景ナイアガラ落とし!
The Beautiful Niagra Drop!
Zekkei Niagara Otoshi
episode.summary: The girls attempt the "Niagra Drop," a crane game technique for securing many small prizes at once. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホールフックで決め!
Pull Off a Hole Hook
Hole Hook de Kime!
episode.summary: The wannabe idols try to learn the trick to retrieving box-type prizes from the crane game. But does Mirai know a faster way? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スライドしちゃう?
Ready to Slide It?
Slide Shichau?
episode.summary: The Crane Game Girls learn their first secret training technique: The Slide! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地球救出アイドル
The Idols That Saved the Earth
Chikyuu Kyuushutsu Idol
episode.summary: Asuka, Kyouko, and Mirai are scouted by a talking gorilla to become idols! But their idol training seems to consist mostly of working in an arcade... and saving the world?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 守れみんなの地球!
Protect Everyone`s Earth!
Mamore Minna no Chikyuu!
episode.summary: Asuka and Kyouko have decided to keep playing crane games to save the Earth, but Mirai is determined to leave! Can CEO Gorilla make a bargain to save the day? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 破られた約束
The Broken Promise
Yaburareta Yakusoku
episode.summary: When the girls learn they`ve been crane gaming under false pretenses, will they knuckle under to save the Earth? Or will they leave it to its fate?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒモ解かれた秘密
Strung Along to the Secret
Himo Tokareta Himitsu
episode.summary: It`s time for the girls to learn the secret of their mission... but only if they can master the trick of catching a prize by the string! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 吊りのライセンス
Tagging License
Tsuri no License
episode.summary: As the asteroids draw closer to the planet, Mirai must invoke her family fishing skills to master the tag grab technique! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望のトライアングル!
Triangle of Hope!
Kibou no Triangle!
episode.summary: The Crane Game Girls learn of one last way to change the asteroid`s course... but will it cost them their lives to do it?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一刀両断袈裟獲り!
Hack and Slash to Win!
Ittouryoudan Kesa Tori
episode.summary: The boss has been kidnapped and a final asteroid is approaching the Earth, bigger than any before it! Can they pull off a final crane game technique big enough to save the day?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 世界をひっくり返せ!
Flip the World
Sekai o Hikkurikaese!
episode.summary: The Crane Game Girls` identities have been revealed to the world, and they`re well on their way to becoming the idols they dreamed they`d be... but only if they can master a new technique without the boss`s advice! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スキマで温泉合宿!
Hot Springs Training in the Gap!
Sukima de Onsen Gasshuku!
episode.summary: The Crane Game Girls take a relaxing rest at a hot springs, but their vacation is cut short when Boss Gorilla runs into an old rival. Can they master the new gap-grabbing technique and win the sexy gorilla prize? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Crane Game Girls
episode.summary: The Crane Game Girls use the last of their power on the Dark Gorilla asteroid! Can they survive? And what of the fate of their boss?! Source: crunchyroll
